conclusion: Top containers (A, B, C, D) will release liquid
The liquid will flow down through the gray board
Colored baffles/sticks will redirect the flow
The liquid must end up in one of the bottom containers (E, F, G, H)
Liquid starts at the top left (green container A)
Falls downward until it hits the long green baffle pointing diagonally right
The green baffle redirects the liquid to the right and downward
The liquid continues until it reaches the right side
At the bottom, it enters the rightmost container, which is H (green)
Liquid starts at the second container from left (yellow container B)
Falls downward until it hits the white baffle in the middle
The white baffle redirects the liquid to the right and downward
It continues and likely reaches container G (white)
Liquid starts at the third container from left (orange/yellow container C)
Falls downward until it hits the orange baffle pointing diagonally left
The orange baffle redirects the liquid to the left and downward
It continues and would reach container F (white/pink border)
Liquid starts at the pink container D
Falls downward until it hits the pink baffle at the bottom left
The pink baffle would redirect the liquid to the left
It would then reach container E (pink)
Liquid from container A will flow into container H
Liquid from container B will flow into container G
Liquid from container C will flow into container F
Liquid from container D will flow into container E
